title: An Open-Label, Single-Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Receptor Occupancy of BMS-984923
description_brief: This project seeks to develop a novel disease-modifying compound for Alzheimer's disease (AD).
description_detailed: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of BMS-984923 in healthy participants. A secondary objective of this study is to conduct a receptor occupancy sub-study aimed at determining drug receptor occupancy at each dose using \[18F\]FPEB Positron Emission Tomography.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Logical Memory II Subscale, Delayed
measures.description: Scores range from 1 to 19; with higher scores indicating better delayed verbal recall.

measures.title: Clinical Dementia Rating scale (CDR)
measures.description: Scores of above 0 indicate progressive decline due to a cognitive disorder.

measures.title: Mini Mental State Exam (MMSE)
measures.description: Scores range from 1 to 30; with higher scores indicating better cognitive performance. Scores \>25 are normal.

measures.title: Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS)
measures.description: Scores range from 3 to 15; with lower scores indicating impaired consciousness.

measures.title: Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS)
measures.description: Scores range from 0 to 15; with higher scores indicating a greater likelihood of depression.

measures.title: Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)
measures.description: Scores range from 0 to 30; with higher scores indicating better cognitive performance.

outcomeMeasures.title: Count of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: A count of participants that experience any adverse events found to be associated with treatment. All adverse events are summarized in the adverse events section.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Up to 7 days after last dose

outcomeMeasures.title: Receptor Occupancy
outcomeMeasures.description: Metabotropic glutamate receptor subtype 5 (mGluR5) occupancy using \[18F\]FPEB Positron Emission Tomography calculated using the percentage of total mGluR5 availability and plasma concentrations of study drug were used to model the relationship between plasma concentration (CP) and receptor occupancy with the conventional sigmoidal maximum receptor occupancy (r\_max) model where IC50 is the CP required to produce 50% of the r\_max. A nonlinear least squares analysis was used to estimate the parameters from all scans. The data supported a model with 1 parameter (IC50, r\_max = 100%). IC80 is the CP required to produce 80% of the r\_max. The outcomes of relevance are the IC50 and IC80 calculated for the model.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Receptor Occupancy is calculated as one value for all participants who underwent \[18F\]FPEB PET.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Up to 24 hours after last dose

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Day 1: Admission, administration of study drug, and 2 night in-patient stay; Day 3: Discharge following the completion of all scheduled procedures. . The Receptor Occupancy model is calculated with data from all participants who underwent \[18F\]FPEB PET.

drug: BMS-984923 (also reported as ALX-001) — a small‑molecule mGluR5 silent allosteric modulator (SAM)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial description states the goal is to develop a novel disease‑modifying compound for Alzheimer’s disease and the compound named is BMS‑984923. Peer‑reviewed work shows BMS‑984923 is a small‑molecule silent allosteric modulator of metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (mGluR5) that prevents Aβ‑oligomer pathological signaling and rescues synaptic deficits in AD models, i.e., it targets AD‑relevant pathology rather than only symptomatic cognition. citeturn0search0turn0search9

Act: Clinical/trial sources describe NCT04805983 as a Phase 1 open‑label single‑ascending dose study of BMS‑984923 evaluating safety, PK and receptor occupancy (with [18F]FPEB PET), consistent with development of a brain‑penetrant small‑molecule therapeutic and target engagement studies. citeturn0search2turn0search5

Additional corroboration: BMS‑984923 has been discussed in translational/industry coverage and was licensed/renamed ALX‑001 for further development, confirming the compound identity across sources. citeturn0search6turn0search4

Reflect: Given the agent is a small molecule (SAM) acting on mGluR5 to block pathological Aβ‑o signaling and restore synapses (disease biology), this fits the definition of 'disease‑targeted small molecule' rather than a biologic, a non‑pathology cognitive enhancer, or a neuropsychiatric symptomatic treatment. No information suggests the trial is purely diagnostic or non‑therapeutic. citeturn0search9turn0search0
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug BMS‑984923 (ALX‑001) is a small‑molecule silent allosteric modulator (SAM) of metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (mGluR5), i.e., it directly targets a neurotransmitter receptor implicated in AD synaptotoxicity. citeturn0search4turn0search1

Act: Clinical registry entries for NCT04805983 describe a Phase‑1 open‑label single‑ascending‑dose study of BMS‑984923 measuring safety, PK and mGluR5 receptor occupancy with [18F]FPEB PET, confirming target engagement at mGluR5 in humans. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Additional supporting evidence: Preclinical work shows BMS‑984923 (SAM) prevents Aβ‑oligomer‑induced mGluR5 pathological signaling and rescues synaptic deficits in AD models; the compound has been licensed/renamed ALX‑001 for clinical development. citeturn0search4turn0search1turn0search6

Reflect: The direct molecular target is a neurotransmitter receptor (mGluR5), so the most specific CADRO category is D) Neurotransmitter Receptors. Although the compound impacts Aβ‑o mediated pathology and synapses, those are downstream/pathology contexts rather than the direct molecular target; therefore 'D' is more accurate than 'A' or 'M'. No evidence in the description indicates multiple unrelated targets or a non‑therapeutic diagnostic trial. citeturn0search4turn0search1

Web search results (key sources used): NCT04805983 trial record (study title, objectives, [18F]FPEB receptor occupancy). citeturn0search0turn0search2; Alzforum summary for ALX‑001 / BMS‑984923 (mGluR5 SAM, preclinical rescue of synapses and cognition). citeturn0search1; PubMed mechanistic/preclinical study describing BMS‑984923 SAM activity and rescue in APP/PS1 mice. citeturn0search4; Probe/MedChem/product summaries describing SAM activity and binding data. citeturn0search5turn0search8; Allyx/BMS licensing and ALX‑001 clinical development press coverage. citeturn0search6turn0search7
